comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Seems likely to be www.spanamwar.com/BlackWilliam.htm He retired in 1919 as a Major General, but www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=59224614 seems to imply that he was a Colonel in the 1915 timeframe. The Military Engineer has a description of his entire military career at books.google.com/books?id=mCUgAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA25&lp... and that confirms that his promotion to General was in 1916. A full page portrait near the beginning of the volume looks to be the same man, but without his glasses.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "William Murray Black (December 8, 1855 – September 24, 1933) was career officer in the United States Army, noted for his ability to organize and train young engineers." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Murray_Black The same man (see other comments there):
